TopicTitle: [1.2.1] Outer Planets Mod (2.1) - Active development has moved, see first post for new thread

Articles.Content: no its not, trans keptunian uses kopernicusTECH, please remember that mod is not compatible with kopernicus

no its not, trans keptunian uses kopernicusTECH, please remember that mod is not compatible with kopernicus

If I understand corectly, current version of Trans-keptunian (v0.4) uses Kopernicus 0.0.7, not kopernicustech? Or am I not getting this right?
Yes, it uses Kopernicus.

Well, they seems to be working nice.

Also, any chance on Plock getting some love soon? Being rescaled Vall, it looks kinda... off, especially with Trans-Keptunian installed.

Well, they seems to be working nice.

Also, any chance on Plock getting some love soon? Being rescaled Vall, it looks kinda... off, especially with Trans-Keptunian installed.

I'm sure when Capt and Eudae will get to Plock they will do an excellent job, in the meantime if you are using Trans-Keptunian I'd say you could remove Plock and keep Putto as the main "pluto-analogue". Alternatively you could try to look at my Pluron-Khato, but keep in mind that the aesthetics may not be at the same level than OPM's.

If I understand corectly, current version of Trans-keptunian (v0.4) uses Kopernicus 0.0.7, not kopernicustech? Or am I not getting this right?

apologies, somehow missed it's update, should work fine then

How do I download Kopernicus? I cannot find the link on that Github page.

EDIT: Scratch that, I found the releases page. But you might want to update link to the OP - https://github.com/BryceSchroeder/Kopernicus/releases

Updated.

I'm sure when Capt and Eudae will get to Plock they will do an excellent job, in the meantime if you are using Trans-Keptunian I'd say you could remove Plock and keep Putto as the main "pluto-analogue". Alternatively you could try to look at my Pluron-Khato, but keep in mind that the aesthetics may not be at the same level than OPM's.

Just added this to the FAQ:

First we want to work on Neidon's moons, which gives New Horizons time to close in on the actual Pluto and give us a glimpse of its features. Once Neidon is done we'll move on to Plock. It will get a moon based on Charon, although perfectly simulating their strange orbital relationship won't be possible in KSP. Don't worry however, we'll make the Plock system feel unique.

- - - Updated - - -

Really glad to see the new version of this awesome mod, but now the Mun seems to have the wrong normal map when seen from a distance or in map view. Instead of craters, it has small mountain ranges and dry river beds. The color seems correct, it's just the elevation that's wrong.

I'll check it out.

Don't worry however, we'll make the Plock system feel unique.

Never doubted you guys for a second

I got into the habit of answering those kind of questions while you were on vacation, it wasn't my intention to bypass you

Isn't the Duna-Ike system also analogous to Pluto and Charon? If you realize that, can you make moons for Plock based on Phobos and Deimos, making Plock and its moons analogous to Mars-Phobos-Deimos?

Hi everyone, I am not sure whether I missed something but to me My precious and by far my favourite moon Tekto still has a very dark texture up close, it is different then the issue on 1.7 beta 2 cause when I land now the terrain in distance is visible with less darker texture but the area around my landing spots is as dark as on the beta 2 vs.

Any advice? I use the latest Kopernikus, trans-keptunian and sigma88 Pluto-Charon inspired mod which by the way work like a charm now with OPM 1.7. Ironically my favourite (I know I am repeating myself) moon doesn't .
Does the now required OPM+Kopernicus take more space than just old OPM? Also, I forgot what folders did older OPM include so now I don't know what to delete.

What's old OPM for you? 1.7 Beta 1/2 or 1.6.5?

Also RAM or hard drive space?

1.7 Beta 2 folders were Kopernicus, OPM and TextureReplacer

1.6.5 folder were CustomAsteroids, DDSLoader, KittopiaSpace, Kopernicus, Nereid, OPM, PlanetShine, TextureReplacer

Javascript is disabled. View full album

That seems to be cloud related, so I suggest you take it up with Eleusis who made that mod for OPM. I can imagine things are going to be going wrong since EVE, upon which the cloud mods are based, is so out-of-date these days.

Ovok used to have an old egg-shaped ScaledSpace version in beta, but the terrain always looked Minmus like during the beta phase. If you never visited it, it was easy to miss. Changed it because until it's fixed, it's just more player friendly for the map and terrain view to match.
Are you sure the issue with the rings is on the EVE side? It was working fine all the time as far as I remember and seems to have broken no longer than a few versions back.

When EVE is out-of-date and Kopernicus is heavily developed atm, I'd call EVE the culprit. The Kopernicus devs can't be held to blame for their mod not working with something that isn't really designed for 1.0.2 as they are.

I just got a crazy idea: I think I might make a Hyperion analogue for Sarnus.

Also great job on the update, rough Ovok, while accidental, looks adorable.
